children.subject:
So you think that 126 + 127 + 188 + breadth is easier than 61c + 170 + breadth? 

I was under the impression that it would be harder but wasn't sure

I think they might be similarly difficult, but I have to admit that 170 hw has way too much pressure and takes way too much time--you could probably use the time for one 170 hw to complete the hw for two courses.
If you want to be very safe, take the breadth, but you can always try what I suggested above for a week or two at the beginning of the semester and drop if needed.

110 has little value to be honest... It is more about mathematical linear algebra than engineering linear algebra--all the linear algebra you would need in most CS research can be learned from the 16 series, 189 and 127. That said, 188 is more important.

Just want to warn that 126 is somewhat heavy because it has both weekly homework (CS 70 style, not easy) and projects (difficulty is somewhat comparable to 61B homework), but I think your 4 commitment along with 188 is doable, though it might approach the difficulty of 61C + 170.

I slightly disagree with the previous poster about Math110 having little value. 

It's true that some of the topics covered in 110 are not the linear algebra you see in engineering - I have yet to see things such as adjoint linear operators or dual spaces in any of my other "industry-focused" courses. However, I enjoyed 110 partly because I love linear algebra as a subject, but also because the way its taught made me a much better mathematician - it really forces you to think more abstractly and become familiar with proofs. 

However, for OP's specific situation, it seems like you already have a math background if you are planning to take 126 and 127 (and presumably have taken 70 and 16ab/54), so the additional benefit of 110 may not be enough for you. I wanted to leave this up on the thread in case anybody else with a different background is in a similar situation. 

On a last note, I took 110 in a semester with 4 techs, and i would say it was among the lighter of my workloads, because in my semester, the homework wasn't actually due to turn in. So I would spend several hours per week trying the homework, but didn't stress as much if I couldn't figure one out, and would just diligently go over the solutions when released. This saved me a lot of time compared to traditional classes. However, I am not sure if this policy is the same for whoever is teaching it in the spring, and 110+126+127 is still a lot of psets to handle per week ;) (the other three techs I took with were a mix of psets and projects so I could switch it up a bit)

history.content:
Definitely taking 126, 127, breadth, reader (13 units), but was wondering whether to add 188 or 110 on top of this.

Reasons for 188: I likely want to do ML stuff in the future and really really wanna get started in AI stuff, which is why I wanted to add 188. Maybe will do some fast.ai this break. (Is this relevant for 188?) One point of caution though is that I want to get an A+ to maybe get into BAIR in the future, which may be harder considering this schedule.

Reasons for 110: Due to time conflict with breadth I will not be able to attend 188 lecture at all. Also I am self studying Axler (linear algebra done right textbook) over break for fun and I feel like I might as well take 110 to get credit for that as well (Is there strong overlap?)

Reasons for another breadth instead: Want to bump my GPA up a little bit and less work. I don't wanna push myself too hard though because last semester I struggled with 61c and 170. Did p well in the classes but found myself working way harder than I thought I would. However this might be because I am bad at project classes and significantly better at math classes, which is better for this intended schedule. Overall, I don't want to work more than 10 hours a day (ideally much less) for the sake of my mental health. In this case, then I will take 188 + 189 + 110 in fall instead of 189 + 188/110 along with recruiting.

Any advice is greatly appreciated!
history.subject: Should I take 188 or 110 along with 126 and 127?

history.content:
Definitely taking 126, 127, breadth, reader (13 units), but was wondering whether to add 188 or 110 on top of this.

Reasons for 188: I likely want to do ML stuff in the future and really really wanna get started in AI stuff, which is why I wanted to add 188. Maybe will do some fast.ai this break. (Is this relevant for 188?) One point of caution though is that I want to get an A+ to maybe get into BAIR in the future, which may be harder considering this schedule.

Reasons for 110: Due to time conflict with breadth I will not be able to attend 188 lecture at all. Also I am self studying Axler (linear algebra done right textbook) over break for fun and I feel like I might as well take 110 to get credit for that as well (Is there strong overlap?)

Reasons for neither: I don't wanna push myself too hard though because last semester I struggled with 61c and 170. Did p well in the classes but found myself working way harder than I thought I would. However this might be because I am bad at project classes and significantly better at math classes, which is better for this intended schedule. Overall, I don't want to work more than 10 hours a day (ideally much less) for the sake of my mental health. In this case, then I will take 188 + 189 + 110 in fall instead of 189 + 188/110 along with recruiting.

Any advice is greatly appreciated!
